alert.note: Alert for Orange County Inland (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Watch issued March 22 at 5:23AM PDT until March 23 at 9:00AM PDT by NWS SanDiego
info.description: ...FLOOD WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 5 PM PDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues to be possible. * WHERE...A portion of Southwest California, including the following areas, Orange County Coastal Areas, Orange County Inland Areas, Riverside County Mountains, San Bernardino County Mountains, San Bernardino and Riverside County Valleys-The Inland Empire, San Gorgonio Pass Near Banning and Santa Ana Mountains and Foothills. * WHEN...Until 5 PM PDT this afternoon. * IMPACTS...Excessive runoff may result in flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - Scattered showers will produce brief moderate to locally heavy rainfall at times through this afternoon. The main threat in the mountains will be for elevations below 4500 feet. - https://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be alert for possible Flood Warnings. Those living in areas prone to flooding should be prepared to take action should flooding develop.
